{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Linksys |model=WRT160N |revision=v1.0 |asin= |fcc_date=11/30/2007 |manuf_country= |is_manuf=No |manuf=CyberTAN |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=Q87-WRT160N |ic_id=3839A-WRT160N |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM4703 |cpu1_cspeed=266 |fla1=4 |fla1_brand=Eon |fla1_model=EN29LV320AB-70TCP |ram1=32 |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial=yes,, 5-pad header,, |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4321 |wi1_chip2_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip2_model=BCM2055 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM5325F |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=100M |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware=DD-WRT,TomatoUSB |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user= |default_pass=admin |oui= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|Ultra RangePlus Wireless-N Broadband Router}} :{{SupportPage|vendor=Linksys|model=WRT160N}} CSE0 serial prefix ==Links of Interest== *[https://openwrt.org/toh/linksys/wrt160n On the '''OpenWrt''' Wiki] *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/30387-cheap-draft-80211n-router-roundup Reviewed in a router round-up on SmallNetBuilder] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linksys_routers Listed on the 'Linksys routers' page on Wikipedia] *[http://vectormm.net/routers/other-routers/59-vosstanovlenie-linksys-wrt-610n-cherez.html On '''VectorMM'''] (RU) ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing DD-WRT=== {{DDWRTNotice|microno}} *[[dd-wrt-wiki:Linksys WRT150N & WRT160N|On DD-WRT Wiki]] # Read the [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=51486 Peacock Announcement] # Download THIS Newd_Mini file. [ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/BrainSlayer-V24-preSP2/2010/08-12-10-r14929/broadcom/dd-wrt.v24_mini_generic.bin dd-wrt.v24_mini_generic.bin]. # Ensure you have a physical ethernet connection to your router, and disable your wireless adapter, antivirus/firewall protection, and any software that makes strong use of your network (BitTorrent, Streaming Audio/Video, etc). # Perform a [[WikiDevi:DD-WRT/Hard reset or 30/30/30|hard 30/30/30]] reset. # Navigate to http://192.168.1.1/ in your web browser of choice. # Enter no username, and the password "admin". # Go to the administration tab. Click on firmware upgrade. # Browse to the .bin file you downloaded in step 2 # Click on the upgrade button and WAIT for the upgrade successful message. # Power cycle your router. Wait until you can see the DD-WRT password screen at http://192.168.1.1/. # Perform another [[WikiDevi:DD-WRT/Hard reset or 30/30/30|30/30/30]] reset on your router. Wait until you can see the password screen at http://192.168.1.1/. # Set a new username and password, and continue on to configure your router like normal. You can now upgrade to any generic DD-WRT build except Mega and Micro. Be sure to always do a hard reset prior to flashing another build, do a power cycle followed by another hard reset after flashing, and NEVER re-use a configuration file from a previous build or another router. Always reconfigure from scratch. ===Flashing TomatoUSB=== *[http://tomatousb.org/doc:build-types Support Chart at Bottom] ==Upgrading== {{Upgrade dd-wrt}} ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== —JP2— 
 VCC  1 o
  TX  2 o
  RX  3 o
 N/C  4 o
 GND  5 o
{{Serial TTL Setup WinXP |serialport = |serial_port_num = |serial_speed = |serial_data_bits = |serial_parity = |serial_stop_bits = |serial_flow_cntl = }} ====Serial Recovery==== *[http://vectormm.net/routers/other-routers/59-vosstanovlenie-linksys-wrt-610n-cherez.html On '''VectorMM'''] (RU) ==Pictures==
